official_title: To repeal the provisions of the Protection of Lawful Commerce in Arms Act prohibiting the bringing of qualified civil liability actions in Federal or State court.
To promote the tracing of firearms used in crimes, and for other purposes.

To provide the Attorney General with greater discretion in issuing Federal firearms licenses, and to authorize temporarily greater scrutiny of Federal firearms licensees who have transferred a firearm unlawfully or had 10 or more crime guns traced back to them in the preceding 2 years.
To promote the tracing of firearms used in crimes, and for other purposes.
To amend chapter 44 of title 18, United States Code, to prohibit the possession of a firearm by a person who is adjudicated to have committed a violent act while a juvenile.
To amend the Public Health Service Act to provide for better understanding of the epidemic of gun violence, and for other purposes.

short_title: Gun Show Background Check Act of 2009
official_title: A bill to establish background check procedures for gun shows.

short_title: Gun Violence Reduction Resources Act of 2016
official_title: To provide for the hiring of 200 additional Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives agents and investigators to enforce gun laws.
To repeal certain appropriations riders that limit the ability of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives to administer the Federal firearms laws.

short_title: Hadiya Pendleton and Nyasia Pryear-Yard Gun Trafficking and Crime Prevention Act of 2016
official_title: To prevent gun trafficking.

To regulate the sale of cases and covers that resemble firearms, to amend the Consumer Product Safety Improvement Act of 2008 with respect to the regulation of toy, look-alike, and imitation firearms, and to provide penalties for a violation of such regulations.
To establish a gun buyback grant program.

To amend the NICS Improvement Amendments Act of 2007 to provide notification to relevant law enforcement agencies in the event that a background check conducted by the National Instant Criminal Background Check System determines that a person may not receive a firearm, and for other purposes.
To ensure secure gun storage and gun safety devices.

To ensure that all individuals who should be prohibited from buying a firearm are listed in the national instant criminal background check system and require a background check for every firearm sale.

short_title: Gun Show Loophole Closing Act of 2013
official_title: To require criminal background checks on all firearms transactions occurring at gun shows.

short_title: Gun Violence Prevention and Safe Communities Act of 2015
official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase the excise tax and special occupational tax in respect of firearms and to increase the transfer tax on any other weapon, and for other purposes.

short_title: Gun Confiscation and Registration Prevention Act
official_title: To prohibit gun confiscation and registration.

short_title: Gun Show Background Check Act of 2011
official_title: A bill to establish background check procedures for gun shows.

short_title: Protecting Gun Rights and Due Process Act
official_title: A bill to provide adequate protections for gun owners.
